snippet: In a move described as a “sovereign decision” by its prime minister, Spain revised its deficit target for 2012 to 5.8 percent of gross domestic product, from 4.4 percent.
abstract: Spain announces that a deepening recession means it will have to abandon its deficit-reduction targets, undermining a new fiscal pact signed by 25 European leaders meant to further entrench budgetary discipline; announcement illustrates how many European economies remain trapped between the need to repair their finances and opposing pressure to restore economic growth.
lead_paragraph: In a move described as a “sovereign decision” by its prime minister, Spain revised its deficit target for 2012 to 5.8 percent of gross domestic product, from 4.4 percent.

headline.seo: Spain Adjusts Deficit-Reduction Target at European Summit
headline.main: Spain Adjusts Deficit-Reduction Target at European Summit
headline.print_headline: At Meeting to Signify Return to Normalcy, Spain Offers Test to Deficit Rules
